Name: Principles of Geographical Information Science (GEGR10039)
Time: Total Hours200, Lecture Hours 22, Feedback/Feedforward Hours 2, Summative  Hours 2, Programme Level Learning and Teaching Hours 4,Directed Learning and Independent Learning Hours170
learningoutcomes: understand the components and a range of the methods which make up geographical information systems and the field of geographical information sciencedisplay knowledge of the multifarious data sources commonly used in GIS, and critically understand the importance of data modelling in the storage of such dataappreciate the functionality of the ArcGIS software, including basic expertise in anlysis, classification, query and integration of vector and raster data and its visualisationapply appropriate cartographic principles in the construction of maps (including an appreciation of map projections)develop an integrated practical project, drawing on appropriate source data, providing meaningful analysis, effective visualisation of output and drawing appropriate conclusions which demonstrate professional level insight
